data.title: Custom node plugin bug.
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Xubuntu 14.04 64-bit.
Godot compiled just two hours ago.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Custom node plugin quits with errors.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Install plugins.
2. Activate custom node plugin in the Project Settings.
3. Create a heart node.
4. Deactivate the custom node plugin in the Project Settings.
5. Click the heart node.
6. Godot quits.

The last messages in the console:

```
settings changed

ERROR: select: Index p_idx out of size (items.size()).
   At: scene/gui/item_list.cpp:177.
ERROR: get_item_metadata: Index p_idx out of size (items.size()).
   At: scene/gui/item_list.cpp:171.
ERROR: select: Index p_idx out of size (items.size()).
   At: scene/gui/item_list.cpp:177.
ERROR: get_item_metadata: Index p_idx out of size (items.size()).
   At: scene/gui/item_list.cpp:171.
ERROR: set_persisting: Condition ' !props.has(p_name) ' is true.
   At: core/globals.cpp:98.

```

data.title: Tutorial button in script tab do not work in steam version.
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
ubuntu 15.10 x64

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The 'tutorial' button in script tab, do not  open the browser in the steam version of the engine.
It works fine in the builds downloaded from the Godot web site.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Launch Godot via Steam.
Click in the tutorial button in the script tab.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Editing exported boolean of base scene child is not working in inherited scene
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Ubuntu 15.10, Godot 2.0

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
If base scene consist of subscene with exported boolean value, editing this value from inherited scene will not always be saved.

**Steps to reproduce:**
_Easy way:_
1.Download sample project.
2. Open "InheritedScene.tscn"
3. Change "Some bool" variable to false
4. Save the scene
5. Reopen the scene
6. Observe "Some bool"  is still true

_Manual way:_
1. Create a "baseScene.tscn"
2. Create "subscene.tscn"
3. Instance  subscene.tscn inside "baseScene.tscn"
4. Create new inherited scene based on "scene1.tscn", save it as "inheritedScene.tscn"
5. Add a script to subscene.tscn,
6. Inside this script add `export (bool) var someBool = false;`
7. Inside baseScene.tscn change someBool of  instancied subscene.tscn to `true`
8. Do all the steps from "Easy way", except the step 1.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Wideo that illustrates the problem: https://youtu.be/wgcsQ5nOGco
Sample project: [SubsceneInheritedSceneBooleanValueIssue.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/155565/SubsceneInheritedSceneBooleanValueIssue.zip)

data.title: RichTextLabel missing get_text() to return string
data.body:
Re: http://godotengine.org/qa/662/richtextlabel-do-not-have-any-way-to-return-text
It has come to my attention that RichTextLabel do not have any get_text() equivalent. Did someone forget to implement it? Surely I am not the only one that need to get all content (text) returned to me as a string for reuse?

data.title: Fixed the bug #3901 on XP
data.body: According to MSDN (https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa365512%28v=vs.85%29.aspx ) if flag 2 (REPLACEFILE_IGNORE_MERGE_ERRORS) is specified then flag 4 (REPLACEFILE_IGNORE_ACL_ERRORS) is superfluous and it causes bug on XP.

data.title: On Windows XP the editor can't overwrite existing files
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Windows XP 32bit

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Create a new project, say "hello_world", create a new scene and save it, edit the project settings and set the start scene, then the console window shows

> ERROR: close: Condition ' rename_error ' is true.
>    At: drivers/windows/file_access_windows.cpp:135

and the project didn't get saved (i.e. the start scene didn't changed).

**Steps to reproduce:**
Already described in issue description.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Raycast stops responding when dealing with parallel collisions
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Windows 7 Pro

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The 3d raycast stops responding/functioning when it hits a flat surface from the side.

In my project I use a raycast for the legs. When I attempt to walk over an object with sides parallel to the raycast, the raycast stops responding and I fly off into the sky.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Load project. Try to walk onto the ramp from the side.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[project.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/155019/project.zip)

data.title: 3dparticles in editor dont match the ones in game
data.body:
**Operating system or device:** Linux

**Issue description:** I have to spend quite a lot of time (as I think everyone does) to tune the particle system to match exactly what I want. After running the game, the particles are totally different from what I was looking at in the editor (mainly, slower/faster)

**Steps to reproduce:** Create a particle system and tweak some values. Notice how they behave, their speed and movement. Play the game and compare.

data.title: fix gradle build on windows
data.body:
`unexpected char: '\'` error occurred when gradle build on windows with custom android modules.
the directory text has both `\` and `/` like `D:\godot\platform/android...`.
after replace `\` with `/`, can build successfully.

data.title: "Parse Error: Unexpected end of file" in inherited .tscn files
data.body:
I'm having the same issue reported in #3062 with the current tip.

```
ERROR: get_dependencies: res://scenes/player.tscn:6 - Parse Error: Unexpected end of file
   At: scene/resources/scene_format_text.cpp:638.
```

```
[gd_scene load_steps=3 format=1]

[ext_resource path="res://scenes/entity.tscn" type="PackedScene" id=1]
[ext_resource path="res://scripts/player.gd" type="Script" id=2]

[node name="Player" instance=ExtResource( 1 )]
...
```

In my case, the editor does not crash, and everything looks normal both in the editor and within the game.

data.title: Position transform is not working for instanced scene nodes that have bones with IK
data.body:
If you have and instanced scene added as a node, and this scene have animation with bones and IK, any transforms for this node relative to parent stopping working - it stays at the same position, rotation and scale as at the moment it was added to the parent. You can move it in the editor and transforms will be showed in the editor, but in the actual play mode they are stopping working. This is leading to very confusing state when positions of things on the game screen are suddenly very different from that was placed in the editor.

[error.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/153731/error.zip)

data.title: Ability to create plugin that is based on a scene
data.body:
Currently if I want to create new node with plugin api I need to use `add_custom_type()` function to provide script that will be the base for a node-plugin. What I would consider the most convenient way to create some types of node-plugins would be the ability to point to a whole scene instead. 
Please note that I haven't used plugin system a lot yet and it might be possible that what I need is already there (in this case please show me the way :))

data.title: Revert "Merge pull request #3814 from est31/iterators_for_for"
data.body:
This reverts commit adf50568890cefb5fc354dbc1b21c4140bb410f9, reversing
changes made to ee2bc87c0ef3cc1a432655ff935e60f32977904d.

As discussed in #3814 and #3891, the current implementation was not giving performance gains, and @reduz wants to have another look at it himself.

For easy reference, the commits that are being reverted are still available in #3814.

Closes #3891, reopens #3765.

data.title: Added relative paths for DirAccess::remove()
data.body:
Follows similar behaviour to DirAccess::rename().

Previously, appending the path was necessary:

```
var dir = Directory.new()
dir.open(path)
dir.remove(path + "file.txt")
```

Should not break backwards compatibility.

data.title: Add TileMap tile origin "Bottom" (for ysort)
data.body:
When using YSort mode in a TileMap, for the child nodes I use y0 as the height on which e.g. a character has their feet, an object touches the ground etc.

But for tiles, y0 is the center or the top. Using the bottom as the tile origin would make it a lot easier to use.

It can be worked around by setting the offset accordingly, but it's unwieldy, as the sprite ends up a tile above the cursor:
![tile_ysort_workaround](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6996191/13430253/a2619b70-dfc4-11e5-823b-94cdb74de5ac.png)

_(Using http://opengameart.org/content/tiny-16-basic by Lanea Zimmerman for demonstration)_

data.title: for loop so slow with current head 46bfcd3
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Windows 10

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
for loop so slow with current head (46bfcd350745d3053a0cab2985d73baae0a4a88d)
My game became so laggy because of `for` running time

**Steps to reproduce:**

``` gdscript
var arr = range(0,100000)

func _ready():
    var time = OS.get_ticks_msec()
    var c = 0
    for i in arr:
        c += i
    print("run in ", OS.get_ticks_msec() - time, " ms")
```

It's 10 ms with 2.0 stable.
and 167 ms with current head.

I guess it's related with PR #3814

data.title: Adding code completion in properties node
data.body: Code completion is very nice now but it should be available when calling set(String property, value)! Is it possible?

data.title: Wrong behaviour on copying texts with accented characters on linux.
data.body:
I can reproduce it on Linux (Xubuntu 14.04) but not in windows 10.

Copying a text with characters like       (in Italian they're very common) and pasting in the engine will paste only the text before the first occurence of one of them.

data.title: Godot's new Q&A site says I could use my Github login, but it doesn't work.
data.body: As the title says, instead I get some error about being unable to access the page or something. I would advise to either fix it or remove the option altogether (so people won't be misled, even though it would be an incredible convenience if it did work).

data.title: Refactored code on GDScript files
data.body:
Some switch cases are used unnecessarily. There are alternatives that bring the same results, and add on top of it all a better code organization.

All that's left is refactoring GDFunctions::get_info().

Changes:
- Swapped switch case in GDFunctions::call() with an array of constant function pointers
- Swapped switch case in GDFunctions::is_deterministic() with comparisons

data.title: Refactored code on GDscript files
data.body:
Some switch cases are used unnecessarily. There are alternatives that bring the same results, and add on top of it all a better code organization.

All that's left is refactoring GDFunctions::get_info().

Changes:
- Swapped switch case in GDFunctions::call() with an array of constant function pointers
- Swapped switch case in GDFunctions::is_deterministic() with comparisons

data.title: "Replace Node by Another Node Type" doesn't confer properties of new node type onto replaced node
data.body: Specifically, when replacing/changing a node that is not a "body" (PhysicsBody2D) into a type of node that is one, the new PhysicsBody does not act as a PhysicsBody in the executed game, and is not detected by get_overlapping_bodies().

data.title: searching for a print
data.body:
I think I am not the only one who is using print for debugging but at some point you have so many "print" and don't know where they are coming from so maybe this could be implemented.

```
42   printl("something happened")
```

Output:
"something happened - path/to/script.gd line 42"

data.title: GDFunctions::is_deterministic improvement suggestion
Clicking link in rich text label fails to find resource loader
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
FreeBSD - godot 2.0

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Just got godot 2.0 up and running and looking through the demo files. The rich text label demo located in demos/gui/rich_text_bbcode has two url links in the example text. These fail to open the url giving the following error (a new window pops up briefly then disappears)

```
ERROR: load: No loader found for resource: http:/www.google.com
   At: core/io/resource_loader.cpp:218.
ERROR: start: Failed loading scene: http:/www.google.com
   At: main/main.cpp:1425.
ERROR: free: Attempt to free invalid ID
   At: servers/spatial_sound/spatial_sound_server_sw.cpp:598.
ERROR: free: Attempt to free invalid ID
   At: servers/spatial_sound_2d/spatial_sound_2d_server_sw.cpp:612.
WARNING: cleanup: ObjectDB Instances still exist!
   At: core/object.cpp:1904.
```

The missing / at the start of the url could be related to the issue, adding an extra / (or several) does not help as it still shows one / in the error message. The res:// url in the [img] tag in the same example text shows the image as it is meant to, so this may be limited to parsing the [url] tag

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open the demo bundled in the source tree at demos/gui/rich_text_bbcode - run it and click one of the links.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/tree/master/demos/gui/rich_text_bbcode

data.title: Gamepad support on OSX
data.body:
Opening this as #49 is very general and full of different discussions.
It would be very nice to finally support joystick input on Mac OSX. Afaik it's the only platform that doesn't have this feature (apart from "experimental" stuff like haiku/blackberry).

I plan on working on this as soon as I get my hands on a mac, but if anyone else wants to step in before this happens, here's what you'd need to do:
- learn how osx handles gamepad input
- figure out how SDL2 generates the gamepad GUIDs and how it orders the buttons/axes
- Call `InputDefault::joy_connection_changed()` on device (dis-)connection and provide it with the device id(starting at 0), name and guid
- recieve gamepad events and send them to the engine using `InputDefault::joy_button`, `joy_axis` and `joy_hat` with the numbering SDL uses (joy_hat takes a bitmask as argument, e.g `InputDefault::HAT_MASK_LEFT | InputDefault::HAT_MASK_DOWN`)

It would be a good idea to read the events in a seperate thread, queue them and send them to the engine once per frame (right before or after it handles keyboard input). You won't have to worry about checking for duplicate events, InputDefault does that for you.

data.title: use joystick name from mapping-db if available
data.body: As they are often more precise/readable then what the hardware provides.

data.title: Script attachment on a scene node does not register as dirty (in need of saving)
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
windows7 64-bit
Godot 2.0 stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
open an existing scene with unscripted root node
use the create script wizard to add script to the node
[get distracted by a phone call, bladder or other AFK event]
close the scene

The problem here is Godot does not register the creation of a script on a node as an action that 'dirties' the scene (meaning it needs saving).  Worse if the scene is then closed (but the script generated was modified and saved) it becomes impossible to reattach the orphaned script because the create script wizard sees the file already exists,

**Steps to reproduce:**

create new scene
add a root node (I used a Node2D)
save the scene
use script wizard to create script for the node
edit script content then save the script (not the scene) in the script editor

[at this point the scene is still "dirty" as it has an unsaved script relationship that will be lost if the scene is closed at this point.  however Godot editor is not aware of this and thus not indicating it to the user with a \* nor warning the user when the scene (or godot editor) is subsequently closed. if the designer gets interrupted AFK while the scene is in this state there is a good probability the scene will be closed and the unsaved script relationship lost.  Furthermore it will become impossible to reattach the scene when the user reloads the scene (and finds it no longer links the script) since the wizard complains that the file already exists.]

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

The reproduction is simple enough I doubt a project is needed.

data.title: Video trailer for Godot 2.0+
data.body:
Ping @punto- @reduz @kubecz3k @her001 @adolson

We've discussed it a bit on IRC, a bit on Facebook, but it's better to have a place where the history is easy to access, quote and discuss further, so let's use a GH issue for that.

---

We need a new video trailer that showcases Godot 2.0 (and as far as possible, future releases too, if we don't want to redo the trailer completely at each new release). It's a must have for the Steam store page (it currently shows older 1.1 videos), and would actually be quite cool to have on the main website and Youtube too (so probably shouldn't be made Steam-specific).

See the logs of Feb 24th for some more input and ideas: http://godot.eska.me/irc-logs/devel/2016-02-24.log (search for "trailer").

Notably, @kubecz3k proposed:

> <kubecz3k> Maybe something like this one: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UX1g5unMVD8 It's easy to edit, pleasant to watch and also easy to extend when something worthy comes out

**Resources:**
- On Facebook, @punto- asked users for footages of their games that could be used in the trailer: https://www.facebook.com/groups/godotengine/permalink/734640606672536/
  - Of particular interest IMO is @kubecz3k's https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wYeGs3BA84w, for which the raw footage material is available at https://mega.nz/#!XBtRFKbZ!q8OK6CAGlfu78qPN0LS9FO6dZao1zSKHVzA8kMRwsCA
- GameFromScratch's showcase of Godot 2.0 (30 min): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=av5SCu8OSS4
- @reduz's video about live editing: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WnpYTxCxdyI

**Tools:**
- @her001 proposed to do the editing in Blender, since he has experience with it
- Alternatively we could use Kdenlive, OpenShot or Cinelerra, but since we have a contributor willing to work on the editing in Blender already, I guess we don't need to overcomplicate it :)

---

Please throw in ideas, link other resources and start thinking about a script, so that we can move on with this topic.
